Package com.dukes.lang.scanner

Describes an abstract interpretation of any programming language scanner.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractScanner<E extends AbstractToken>
    Represents an object that can produce AbstractTokens from a given Inputter.
    AbstractToken<E extends Enum<E>,V>
    Represents a token within a given grammar.
    FileInputter
    Reads characters from a file.
    Inputter
    Describes an object that iterates over an entire object for characters.
    StringInputter
    A StringInputter parses through a string as the program input.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    IllegalTokenTypeException
    An exception that should be thrown when a given token isn't given the proper data.
    LexicalAnalysisException
    An exception that is thrown when there is a potential token present that is valid in the context-free environment but does not conform to the language specific context.
    LexicalScanningException
    An exception that is thrown when there is characters' present in a Inputter that does not conform to the language grammar or would otherwise cause an error in the reading of code.

Package com.dukes.lang.scanner Description

Describes an abstract interpretation of any programming language scanner. This is clear in classes such as AbstractScanner and AbstractToken. This also allows for different implementations to have complete control over how the scanning process is done. This is shown in the Inputter class, as it doesn't know how to read characters in a stream, but provides the framework to do so. This is done so that we can reason about the theoretics without the direct implementation

Exceptions provided include IllegalTokenTypeException, LexicalScanningException, and LexicalAnalysisException. Each is explained in detail within their class.
